meanings.definition: Having a price already marked on an item before sale.
meanings.sent1: The prepriced shirt made shopping easy for customers.
meanings.sent2: The prepriced items on the clearance rack were selling quickly.
meanings.sent3: The prepriced toy had kids excited to buy it without asking for the cost.
meanings.sent4: Her prepriced paintings were a steal for art collectors.
meanings.sent5: The prepriced car was a great deal for anyone looking to buy.

meanings.definition: To mark a price on an item before sale.
meanings.sent1: The store prepriced all the new inventory before putting it on the shelves.
meanings.sent2: She prepriced each item carefully to ensure accurate pricing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous employee prepriced all the items with funny fake prices.
meanings.sent4: He prepriced the antiques with care, knowing their true value.
meanings.sent5: The team prepriced the products efficiently to save time during the sale event.
